result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terrance A Lewis

records.addlTxt: All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Terrance A Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy in Court for Terrance A Lewis.  Attorney Jacob Daniel Corr appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements made regarding bail. State did not object to bail modification. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court CONVERTED CASH BAIL TO SIGNATURE BOND. Court VACATED Scheduling Conference date. Case adjourned for Status hearing, Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:15 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defense Motion to Modify Cash Bond; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

BAIL HEARING scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:15am via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to Victim Witness Advocate.

Defendant Terrance A Lewis appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael F Torphy appeared by video for Terrance A Lewis.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Oscar Espitia. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
based on the DA (Jacob Corr) the case is re-assigned to Br. 46 Judge Feiss.

Attorney Michael F Torphy in court, defendant Terrance A Lewis not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense request's an adjournment due to co-defendant not yet having counsel. Court grants the adjournment. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter re:  defendant.  (Michael Gibson - #2022008163, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Michael F Torphy in court, appear by video defendant Terrance A Lewis not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Torphy needs more time to allow co defendant case to be heard together. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067363,
Payable Number: 1020432,
Receipt Number: 22RP028936,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Terrance A Lewis not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V Lee hearing or stats. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with JAG
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES: 
 Defendant Terrance A Lewis in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Terrance A Lewis in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
